title: International Zero Waste Month Kickoff Summit
summary: Launch event for IZWM 2025 with global leaders and changemakers
description: Join us for the grand opening of International Zero Waste Month 2025! This 2-day summit features keynote addresses from environmental ministers, breakthrough circular economy initiatives, and networking with 1000+ participants from 40+ countries. Topics include policy innovation, corporate sustainability, community action, and youth leadership. Virtual attendance available.

title: Zero Waste Cities Workshop Series
summary: 4-week intensive training for municipal leaders on zero waste implementation
description: Comprehensive workshop series designed for city officials, urban planners, and waste management professionals. Learn proven strategies for transitioning your city to zero waste. Topics: waste audits, policy frameworks, public engagement, procurement policies, and measuring success. Includes site visits to successful zero waste communities and ongoing mentorship.

title: Community Zero Waste Challenge 2025
summary: Month-long challenge to help 10000 households reduce waste by 50%
description: Join thousands of households across Asia in the Community Zero Waste Challenge! Over 4 weeks, learn practical skills through weekly webinars, receive a zero waste starter kit, participate in community swap events, and compete for prizes. Topics include: composting, plastic-free shopping, repair & reuse, and advocacy. Family-friendly activities every weekend.

title: University Zero Waste Innovation Competition
summary: Student teams compete to design circular economy solutions
description: Call for student innovators! Design products, services, or systems that advance zero waste goals. Categories: product design, business models, technology solutions, and community programs. Finalists receive mentorship from industry experts, present at the IZWM Summit, and compete for $50000 in prizes. Open to undergraduate and graduate students.

title: Circular Fashion Revolution Festival
summary: 3-day celebration of sustainable fashion and textile circularity
description: Experience the future of fashion! This festival features: clothing swap for 5000+ items, repair café with expert tailors, upcycling workshops, sustainable fashion show, talks from ethical brands, and a marketplace with 100+ zero waste vendors. Learn about textile recycling, natural dyes, and closing the loop on fashion waste. All ages welcome!

title: Plastic Free July Launch Day
summary: Kickoff celebration with pledges, workshops, and plastic-free marketplace
description: Start your Plastic Free July journey with a bang! Join hundreds of participants for workshops on alternatives to single-use plastics, cooking demos for zero waste meals, DIY workshops for making reusable products, kids' activities, live music, and a marketplace featuring 50+ plastic-free vendors. Take the plastic-free pledge and receive a starter kit!

title: Plastic Free Business Transformation Bootcamp
summary: Intensive 2-day bootcamp for businesses eliminating plastic packaging
description: Help your business go plastic-free! This bootcamp covers: plastic audit methodology, alternative materials sourcing, redesigning packaging, supplier negotiations, customer communication, and regulatory compliance. Case studies from businesses that successfully eliminated plastic. Includes 6-month implementation support and certification.
address: Jl. Letjen MT Haryono, Jakarta Selatan

title: Plastic Free Schools Challenge
summary: Month-long program engaging 500 schools to eliminate single-use plastics
description: Get your school plastic-free! This challenge provides resources for schools to: conduct waste audits, implement plastic-free lunch programs, organize student-led campaigns, and celebrate achievements. Weekly webinars for teachers, activity kits for students, parent engagement resources, and recognition awards. Track your school's impact!

title: Ocean Cleanup & Beach Festival
summary: Massive coastal cleanup combined with ocean conservation education festival
description: Join the region's largest beach cleanup event! 2000+ volunteers will clean 15 beaches simultaneously while learning about ocean conservation. After the cleanup: marine biodiversity exhibits, ocean conservation talks, sustainable seafood cooking demos, beach games for kids, and live music. All waste will be audited and recycled.

title: DIY Zero Waste Products Workshop Series
summary: Weekly hands-on workshops to make your own plastic-free essentials
description: Learn to make your own zero waste products! Four weekly workshops covering: Week 1 - Natural cleaning products; Week 2 - Personal care items (deodorant, toothpaste); Week 3 - Kitchen essentials (beeswax wraps, produce bags); Week 4 - Gift wrapping & party supplies. All materials included. Take home 20+ products!

title: Global Plastics Treaty Civil Society Forum
summary: Strategic convening of NGOs and advocates ahead of treaty negotiations
description: Critical gathering of civil society organizations to coordinate advocacy for the Global Plastics Treaty negotiations. Sessions on: treaty language analysis, negotiation strategy, media engagement, grassroots mobilization, and coalition building. Develop unified positions and action plans. Closed event for accredited organizations.

title: Plastics Treaty Public Education Campaign
summary: Month-long awareness campaign about the Global Plastics Treaty
description: Help spread the word about the historic Global Plastics Treaty! This campaign provides: educational webinars, social media toolkits, infographics in 15 languages, template letters to government officials, petition drives, and local action guides. Engage your community and advocate for a strong treaty that ends plastic pollution.

title: Scientists & Researchers Briefing on Plastics Treaty
summary: Technical briefing on latest research informing treaty negotiations
description: Expert presentation of cutting-edge research on plastic pollution impacts, solutions, and policy recommendations. Topics: microplastics in human health, marine ecosystem impacts, chemical additives, circular economy modeling, and policy effectiveness. Q&A with leading researchers. Support evidence-based treaty language.

title: Youth Voices for Plastics Treaty
summary: Youth summit to amplify young voices in treaty negotiations
description: Young people will inherit the plastic pollution crisis - ensure your voice is heard! This youth summit features: training on policy advocacy, media skills, meeting with negotiators, developing youth position paper, and organizing actions. For participants ages 15-30. Travel scholarships available for delegates to attend actual negotiations.

title: Business Leaders Dialogue on Plastics Treaty
summary: High-level dialogue on industry's role in implementing the treaty
description: Engage business leaders on their responsibility and opportunity in the Global Plastics Treaty. Discuss: extended producer responsibility, design for circularity, industry accountability, innovation investments, and fair transition. Featuring CEOs from packaging, retail, and waste management sectors. Media attendance invited.

title: COP30 Pre-Conference: Waste & Climate Nexus
summary: Regional preparatory conference on waste sector's role in climate action
description: Prepare for COP30 with analysis of waste management's climate impacts and solutions. Topics: methane from landfills, circular economy for emissions reduction, waste-to-energy controversies, zero waste co-benefits, and NDC commitments. Develop regional position for COP30 negotiations. Government delegates and civil society.

title: Zero Waste Climate Solutions Showcase
summary: Exhibition of zero waste innovations reducing greenhouse gas emissions
description: Discover breakthrough zero waste solutions fighting climate change! Exhibition features: composting systems capturing methane, packaging-free retail models, circular business innovations, community-scale recycling, and more. Pitch competition for startups ($100000 prize). Technical workshops, investor meetings, and networking.

title: Community Climate Action: The Zero Waste Way
summary: Training series on community-led zero waste climate solutions
description: Empower your community to fight climate change through zero waste! 4-week training covers: composting to reduce methane, community recycling systems, repair cafés, food waste prevention, and advocacy for systemic change. Includes toolkit, seed funding for projects ($500-2000), and 6-month mentorship. For community leaders.

title: Youth Strike for Climate & Zero Waste
summary: Global youth climate strike with zero waste demands
description: Join millions of young people worldwide demanding climate action and zero waste policies! Coordinated strikes across 50+ cities in Asia. March to government buildings, deliver petitions, hold die-ins, and present youth climate manifesto. All events zero waste with reusable signs and waste-free gatherings. Ages 13+.

title: COP30 Watch Party & Action Planning
summary: Live streaming of COP30 negotiations with analysis and action planning
description: Can't attend COP30 in person? Join our watch party! Live stream key negotiations with expert commentary, discuss implications for our region, organize solidarity actions, draft post-COP advocacy plans, and connect with activists across Asia. Daily sessions throughout the conference. Snacks and coffee provided!
